u.a: voiced palato-alveolar affricate replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
first unstressed syllable omitted in "another"; second element of cluster omitted in "floor";
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
laık ə bıt ə lʌntʃ dɑ:d
ɡɒt ə lɒt ə mi:t ın maı maʊɵ

g.ga: I'm a silly-billy throwing it down

u.a: maınz ə sılı bılı frəʊıŋ [*] daʊn
voiceless dental fricative replaced by voiceless labio-dental fricative;
referring to throwing her fork on the floor;
voiced dental fricative replaced by voiced alveolar plosive;
alveolar nasal replaced by bilabial nasal;
diphthong replaced by close back vowel;
laık ə kʌp ə tıi dædi
maınz [*] ə bıɡ ɡə:l ɒn wɛnzdeı
wɔt ə dəʊz [*] kɔ:d əʊvə dɛə [*]
voiced dental fricatives replaced by voiced alveolar plosives;
n̩d əɡɛn n̩d əɡɛn n̩d əɡɛn
laık ə ɡəʊ ɒn ə treın

g.ga: ? a little one over there is going to come

u.a: wʌn əʊvə ðɛə ɡəʊıŋ tə kʌm lıtʊ wʌn

g.ga: we're going in a caravan again in a long time

u.a: ɡəʊın ın ə kærəvæn nʌdə [*] wʌn lɒŋ taımz
dəʊz ə bıɡ wʌmz ɒn ə laıt

CHAT.comment: 1. wh- questions at this stage have intonational falls. 2. Yes/no questions are not yet used. 3. Personal pronouns still confused at this stage , e.g.'mine' , 'mine's' , 'my' used for 'I'; 'mine' used for 'me'.
